sect1.title: A Brief History of &eprints;
sect1.para: The EPrints project was created by Professor Stephen Harnad.

row.entry: Mike Jewell joins EPrints, working primarily on installer software

sect1.title: The Road Ahead
sect1.para: At the time of writing the current plan of attack is as follows.
sect1.formalpara: &eprints; 2 Beta-1 (Olive) Core system in beta - ie. metadata and filesystem. Still missing many scripts and auxilery features. A brave admin should be able to deploy this version and keep updating it.

&eprints; 2 Beta-2 (Tomato) Whole system in beta - ie. It should all work now, but still has some unfixed bugs. No (very few) new features will be added after this point. Should be safe to use, but the code still will change a little between here and the actual official release.
&eprints; 2.0 (Double Cheese) Whole system works. All documentation written. Phrases files have been translated into several languages. Several default setups available.

sect2.title: Why do the milestones all have silly names?
sect2.para: We wanted to give each stage a name, it makes it easier to talk about. We didn't want a logical order as we are likely to invent sub-milestones between them. We just picked a set of words we liked, and we like pizza.

sect1.title: The &eprints; logo
sect1.para: The Folder Jigsaw logo was created by Christopher Gutteridge. It was supposed to encompass "archives","documents", OAI, "skywriting", "modularity/extensibility" and the IAM research groups visual identity.
The base version is a 684x668 XCF file (For the GIMP Editor). You are welcome to modify it for your own archive, maybe have your own logo in the jigsaw.
For a high quality version contact support@eprints.org.
